TextBody:
Hello,

I hope you are well.
The engineering team has identified some requests related to the Connected request from the agent, having the username empty (this situation occurs when no users are logged on the PC).
Can you please let us know how the agents were deployed(whether manually/automatically using some tool - which tool)?
In our last session with Anatoli we could see that he could restart the service on the computers even if he wasn't connected to the machine like as an RDP.
When this operation is performed via command line (EPP service restart) must the user be logged in on that computer? Or does this work even if the user is not logged in?
This would partially explain the requests from the agent with the username empty and when no users are logged on to a machine, and the logs are not received to the server side.

Best regards,
Alin Anca

Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix - DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
CoSoSys Ltd www.endpointprotector.com

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000GKZq1:ref

Hi Alin,

the Endpoint Protector Agent is distributed using SCCM.
The installation with SCCM is carried out with the system user.

Please note:

  *   The service restart in the sessions was done via PsExec.
  *   With PsExec, the entered commandlines are executed directly on the client. Regardless of a user login.

However, an empty username doesn't explain why we no longer see block events in the console.
The error is also happening with my test client. A user is logged on and the agent is shown as connected.

I exported yesterday the Endpoint Protector logs for our service report and saw that there have been no events with type Blocked since 17.10.2024.
[cid:image002.png@01DB2F63.2B5F1140]

With round about 120.000 installations, this is rather unlikely. I will therefore change the priority to Critical.

@Markus Durst<mailto:Markus.Durst@netwrix.com> @claudia.kurbjuhn@netwrix.com<mailto:claudia.kurbjuhn@netwrix.com>: Please prioritize the Case. We need a fix as soon as possible.


Mit freundlichen Grüßen
ANATOLI LORENZ

Hi Alin,

 

the Endpoint Protector Agent is distributed using SCCM.

The installation with SCCM is carried out with the system user.

 

Please note:


	The service restart in the sessions was done via PsExec.
	With PsExec, the entered commandlines are executed directly on the client. Regardless of a user login.


 

However, an empty username doesn't explain why we no longer see block events in the console.

The error is also happening with my test client. A user is logged on and the agent is shown as connected.

 

I exported yesterday the Endpoint Protector logs for our service report and saw that there have been no events with type Blocked since 17.10.2024.



 

With round about 120.000 installations, this is rather unlikely. I will therefore change the priority to Critical.

 

@Markus Durst  @claudia.kurbjuhn@netwrix.com: Please prioritize the Case. We need a fix as soon as possible.

 

 


Mit freundlichen Grüßen 

ANATOLI LORENZ

Hello,

I hope you are well.
The engineering team has identified some requests related to the Connected request from the agent, having the username empty (this situation occurs when no users are logged on the PC).
Can you please let us know how the agents were deployed(whether manually/automatically using some tool - which tool)?
In our last session with Anatoli we could see that he could restart the service on the computers even if he wasn't connected to the machine like as an RDP.
When this operation is performed via command line (EPP service restart) must the user be logged in on that computer? Or does this work even if the user is not logged in?
This would partially explain the requests from the agent with the username empty and when no users are logged on to a machine, and the logs are not received to the server side.

TextBody:
Hello,

Thank you for your time this morning.
We have discussed with the DevOps team the matter of the 98% memory usage that is shown on the UI side, and in reality only 7GB out of 30GB Ram are used, the rest is the memory cache, this is why is displayed like that in the UI.
After an analysis on the usage of resources, we managed to optimize a cache rebuild process to run at a larger time interval in order for the workers to be more quick in bringing the logs. An increase in the memory resource section would unfortnately not bring improvements for the time being.
I am sending you a invite for 15:00 CET to discuss again about this matter and after that we will continue the investigation in the backend for the client version issue, please see the link below:
Join the meeting now

Best regards,
Alin Anca

Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix - DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
CoSoSys Ltd www.endpointprotector.com

Hi Alin,

 

the Endpoint Protector Agent is distributed using SCCM.

The installation with SCCM is carried out with the system user.

 

Please note:


	The service restart in the sessions was done via PsExec.
	With PsExec, the entered commandlines are executed directly on the client. Regardless of a user login.


 

However, an empty username doesn't explain why we no longer see block events in the console.

The error is also happening with my test client. A user is logged on and the agent is shown as connected.

 

I exported yesterday the Endpoint Protector logs for our service report and saw that there have been no events with type Blocked since 17.10.2024.



 

With round about 120.000 installations, this is rather unlikely. I will therefore change the priority to Critical.

 

@Markus Durst  @claudia.kurbjuhn@netwrix.com: Please prioritize the Case. We need a fix as soon as possible.

Hello,

Thank you for your time this morning.
We have discussed with the DevOps team the matter of the 98% memory usage that is shown on the UI side, and in reality only 7GB out of 30GB Ram are used, the rest is the memory cache, this is why is displayed like that in the UI.
After an analysis on the usage of resources, we managed to optimize a cache rebuild process to run at a larger time interval in order for the workers to be more quick in bringing the logs. An increase in the memory resource section would unfortnately not bring improvements for the time being.
I am sending you a invite for 15:00 CET to discuss again about this matter and after that we will continue the investigation in the backend for the client version issue, please see the link below:

We have discussed with the DevOps team the matter of the 98% memory usage that is shown on the UI side, and in reality only 7GB out of 30GB Ram are used, the rest is the memory cache, this is why is displayed like that in the UI.

Hi Alin,

 

the Endpoint Protector Agent is distributed using SCCM.

The installation with SCCM is carried out with the system user.

 

Please note:


	The service restart in the sessions was done via PsExec.
	With PsExec, the entered commandlines are executed directly on the client. Regardless of a user login.


 

However, an empty username doesn't explain why we no longer see block events in the console.

The error is also happening with my test client. A user is logged on and the agent is shown as connected.

 

I exported yesterday the Endpoint Protector logs for our service report and saw that there have been no events with type Blocked since 17.10.2024.

I hope you are well.
The engineering team has identified some requests related to the Connected request from the agent, having the username empty (this situation occurs when no users are logged on the PC).
Can you please let us know the how the agents were deployed(whether manually/automatically using some tool - which tool)?
In our last session with Anatoli we could see that he could restart the service on the computers even if he wasn't connected to the machine like as an RDP.
When this operation is performed via command line (EPP service restart) must the user be logged in on that computer? Or does this work even if the user is not logged in?
This would partially explain the requests from the agent with the username empty and when no users are logged on to a machine, and the logs are not received to the server side.

Best regards,
Alin Anca

Hello,

Thank you for your time this morning.
We have discussed with the DevOps team the matter of the 98% memory usage that is shown on the UI side, and in reality only 7GB out of 30GB Ram are used, the rest is the memory cache, this is why is displayed like that in the UI.
After an analysis on the usage of resources, we managed to optimize a cache rebuild process to run at a larger time interval in order for the workers to be more quick in bringing the logs. An increase in the memory resource section would unfortnately not bring improvements for the time being.
I am sending you a invite for 15:00 CET to discuss again about this matter and after that we will continue the investigation in the backend for the client version issue, please see the link below:
Join the meeting now

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000GKZq1:ref

 


Hi Alin,

 

the Endpoint Protector Agent is distributed using SCCM.

The installation with SCCM is carried out with the system user.

 

Please note:


	The service restart in the sessions was done via PsExec.
	With PsExec, the entered commandlines are executed directly on the client. Regardless of a user login.


 

However, an empty username doesn't explain why we no longer see block events in the console.

The error is also happening with my test client. A user is logged on and the agent is shown as connected.

 

I exported yesterday the Endpoint Protector logs for our service report and saw that there have been no events with type Blocked since 17.10.2024.



 

With round about 120.000 installations, this is rather unlikely. I will therefore change the priority to Critical.

 

@Markus Durst  @claudia.kurbjuhn@netwrix.com: Please prioritize the Case. We need a fix as soon as possible.

 

 


Mit freundlichen Grüßen 

ANATOLI LORENZ

Hello,

Thank you for your time this morning.
We have discussed with the DevOps team the matter of the 98% memory usage that is shown on the UI side, and in reality only 7GB out of 30GB Ram are used, the rest is the memory cache, this is why is displayed like that in the UI.
After an analysis on the usage of resources, we managed to optimize a cache rebuild process to run at a larger time interval in order for the workers to be more quick in bringing the logs. An increase in the memory resource section would unfortnately not bring improvements for the time being.
I am sending you a invite for 15:00 CET to discuss again about this matter and after that we will continue the investigation in the backend for the client version issue, please see the link below:

Hi Alin,

the Endpoint Protector Agent is distributed using SCCM.
The installation with SCCM is carried out with the system user.

Please note:

  1.  The service restart in the sessions was done via PsExec.
  2.  With PsExec, the entered commandlines are executed directly on the client. Regardless of a user login.

However, an empty username doesn't explain why we no longer see block events in the console.
The error is also happening with my test client. A user is logged on and the agent is shown as connected.

I exported yesterday the Endpoint Protector logs for our service report and saw that there have been no events with type Blocked since 17.10.2024.
[cid:image001.png@01DB31F0.EE6E9C20]

With round about 120.000 installations, this is rather unlikely. I will therefore change the priority to Critical.

@Markus Durst<mailto:Markus.Durst@netwrix.com> @claudia.kurbjuhn@netwrix.com<mailto:claudia.kurbjuhn@netwrix.com>: Please prioritize the Case. We need a fix as soon as possible.

Hi Alin,

 

the Endpoint Protector Agent is distributed using SCCM.

The installation with SCCM is carried out with the system user.

 

Please note:


	The service restart in the sessions was done via PsExec.
	With PsExec, the entered commandlines are executed directly on the client. Regardless of a user login.


 

However, an empty username doesn't explain why we no longer see block events in the console.

The error is also happening with my test client. A user is logged on and the agent is shown as connected.

 

I exported yesterday the Endpoint Protector logs for our service report and saw that there have been no events with type Blocked since 17.10.2024.



 

With round about 120.000 installations, this is rather unlikely. I will therefore change the priority to Critical.

Hello,

Thank you for your time this morning.
We have discussed with the DevOps team the matter of the 98% memory usage that is shown on the UI side, and in reality only 7GB out of 30GB Ram are used, the rest is the memory cache, this is why is displayed like that in the UI.
After an analysis on the usage of resources, we managed to optimize a cache rebuild process to run at a larger time interval in order for the workers to be more quick in bringing the logs. An increase in the memory resource section would unfortnately not bring improvements for the time being.
I am sending you a invite for 15:00 CET to discuss again about this matter and after that we will continue the investigation in the backend for the client version issue, please see the link below:

Hi Alin,

the Endpoint Protector Agent is distributed using SCCM.
The installation with SCCM is carried out with the system user.

Please note:

  1.  The service restart in the sessions was done via PsExec.
  2.  With PsExec, the entered commandlines are executed directly on the client. Regardless of a user login.

However, an empty username doesn't explain why we no longer see block events in the console.
The error is also happening with my test client. A user is logged on and the agent is shown as connected.

I exported yesterday the Endpoint Protector logs for our service report and saw that there have been no events with type Blocked since 17.10.2024.
[cid:image001.png@01DB31F6.8395CCB0]

With round about 120.000 installations, this is rather unlikely. I will therefore change the priority to Critical.

@Markus Durst<mailto:Markus.Durst@netwrix.com> @claudia.kurbjuhn@netwrix.com<mailto:claudia.kurbjuhn@netwrix.com>: Please prioritize the Case. We need a fix as soon as possible.


Mit freundlichen Grüßen
ANATOLI LORENZ

This would partially explain the requests from the agent with the username empty and when no users are logged on to a machine, and the logs are not received to the server side.

We have discussed with the DevOps team the matter of the 98% memory usage that is shown on the UI side, and in reality only 7GB out of 30GB Ram are used, the rest is the memory cache, this is why is displayed like that in the UI.

Hi Alin,

 

the Endpoint Protector Agent is distributed using SCCM.

The installation with SCCM is carried out with the system user.

 

Please note:


	The service restart in the sessions was done via PsExec.
	With PsExec, the entered commandlines are executed directly on the client. Regardless of a user login.


 

However, an empty username doesn't explain why we no longer see block events in the console.

The error is also happening with my test client. A user is logged on and the agent is shown as connected.

 

I exported yesterday the Endpoint Protector logs for our service report and saw that there have been no events with type Blocked since 17.10.2024.



 

With round about 120.000 installations, this is rather unlikely. I will therefore change the priority to Critical.

 

@Markus Durst  @claudia.kurbjuhn@netwrix.com: Please prioritize the Case. We need a fix as soon as possible.

 

 


Mit freundlichen Grüßen

Hello,

Thank you for your time this morning.
We have discussed with the DevOps team the matter of the 98% memory usage that is shown on the UI side, and in reality only 7GB out of 30GB Ram are used, the rest is the memory cache, this is why is displayed like that in the UI.
After an analysis on the usage of resources, we managed to optimize a cache rebuild process to run at a larger time interval in order for the workers to be more quick in bringing the logs. An increase in the memory resource section would unfortnately not bring improvements for the time being.
I am sending you a invite for 15:00 CET to discuss again about this matter and after that we will continue the investigation in the backend for the client version issue, please see the link below:

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000GKZq1:ref


Hi Alin,

the Endpoint Protector Agent is distributed using SCCM.
The installation with SCCM is carried out with the system user.

Please note:

  1.  The service restart in the sessions was done via PsExec.
  2.  With PsExec, the entered commandlines are executed directly on the client. Regardless of a user login.

However, an empty username doesn't explain why we no longer see block events in the console.
The error is also happening with my test client. A user is logged on and the agent is shown as connected.

I exported yesterday the Endpoint Protector logs for our service report and saw that there have been no events with type Blocked since 17.10.2024.
[cid:image002.png@01DB3512.004C85A0]

With round about 120.000 installations, this is rather unlikely. I will therefore change the priority to Critical.

@Markus Durst<mailto:Markus.Durst@netwrix.com> @claudia.kurbjuhn@netwrix.com<mailto:claudia.kurbjuhn@netwrix.com>: Please prioritize the Case. We need a fix as soon as possible.

Hi Alin,

 

the Endpoint Protector Agent is distributed using SCCM.

The installation with SCCM is carried out with the system user.

 

Please note:


	The service restart in the sessions was done via PsExec.
	With PsExec, the entered commandlines are executed directly on the client. Regardless of a user login.


 

However, an empty username doesn't explain why we no longer see block events in the console.

The error is also happening with my test client. A user is logged on and the agent is shown as connected.

 

I exported yesterday the Endpoint Protector logs for our service report and saw that there have been no events with type Blocked since 17.10.2024.



 

With round about 120.000 installations, this is rather unlikely. I will therefore change the priority to Critical.

 

@Markus Durst  @claudia.kurbjuhn@netwrix.com: Please prioritize the Case. We need a fix as soon as possible.

 

 


Mit freundlichen Grüßen

Hi Alin,

 

the Endpoint Protector Agent is distributed using SCCM.

The installation with SCCM is carried out with the system user.

 

Please note:


	The service restart in the sessions was done via PsExec.
	With PsExec, the entered commandlines are executed directly on the client. Regardless of a user login.

The error is also happening with my test client. A user is logged on and the agent is shown as connected.

 

I exported yesterday the Endpoint Protector logs for our service report and saw that there have been no events with type Blocked since 17.10.2024.

Hi Alin,

 

the Endpoint Protector Agent is distributed using SCCM.

The installation with SCCM is carried out with the system user.

 

Please note:


	The service restart in the sessions was done via PsExec.
	With PsExec, the entered commandlines are executed directly on the client. Regardless of a user login.


 

However, an empty username doesn't explain why we no longer see block events in the console.

The error is also happening with my test client. A user is logged on and the agent is shown as connected.

 

I exported yesterday the Endpoint Protector logs for our service report and saw that there have been no events with type Blocked since 17.10.2024.



 

With round about 120.000 installations, this is rather unlikely. I will therefore change the priority to Critical.

 

@Markus Durst  @claudia.kurbjuhn@netwrix.com: Please prioritize the Case. We need a fix as soon as possible.
